title: The Infirmary :D
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yawn.gif[/img] Post here if you're not feeling so healthy. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-bloody.gif[/img]

I'll kick things off down here at the low end of the scale of medical emergency, with my wimpy little sore throat and runny nose (oh, boo hoo).

----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Re: The Infirmary :D
content:
I didn't feel good yesterday. Was all tired all the time, plus headache part of the time. I felt like going back to bed but that'd make my head hurt more.
Oh, boo hoo. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img]

I'm ok today.____________
I have a boring signature.

...
Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site[/url].

title: Re: The Infirmary :D
content:
I'm as hungover as hell.

And believe me, I mean that, I woke up drunk.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

title: The Spleen Is Healthy
content:
I remembered not to eat while drinking vodka last night, so I've avoided a hangover. The past couple of weekends didn't quite work out quite that well, though fortunately I didn't pass out or throw up.

So, apart from a few mildly aching muscles, a stomach requesting some kind of greasy food, and a slurry brain, I feel quite fine.

title: Re: The Spleen Is Healthy
content:
Wow, 50% hung over , 50% illnesses...we should start an AA topic or something.------------------
[url=http://www.szevvy.net]www.szevvy.net[/url], for all your Wombat needs. You know you want to.
A member of the LevelLord fan club.

title: Re: The Spleen Is Healthy
content:
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Haha, yeah..

Anyways.. I've been quite healthy recently except an arm that hurts very little because I hit it somewhere and a few scratches our cats have produced. My problems have been mostly in the mind. I haven't been able to concentrate that much on anything, etc etc.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Fatigue
content: I'm just underslept... School starts for me in 1 week, so I'm trying to get as much fun in these last 7 days as I can.

title: Re: Fatigue
content:
Ugh, I'm really tired.
on monday I vomited too. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img]

[hr]

---Freeyorp

title: Re: Fatigue
content:
I doubt it. Besides, I'm not gonna be sick just because I have a bit less slime...

I usually keep it out, but yellow and even hardened stuff isn't good. So I have to get rid of that...

It's gradually becoming better now. My throat, I mean. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

title: Re: The Infirmary :D
content:
I don't particularly like being ill, so I generally just don't do it.
(I do get something every decade or so... it's annoying having to lie down the entire time.)

However my throat does currently annoy me a little; it feels like there's a bite of food stuck in there, and has been for 24 hours.
Swallowing obviously doesn't work, and a few times at work it felt like it almost started some retroperistalsis, which wasn't really pleasant.
It's probably just that I was in the cold for too long yesterday, even though it feels different, since there's no itching or pain.
Oh well, thanks for asking. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Get well soon everybody that needs it!Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: The Infirmary :D
content:
Sometimes I get recurring ailments that come and go and then come back for a sequel. Every time they come back I think, "Oh, so this is it then? Am I going to be stuck with this condition for the rest of my days?" and then forget about it and get used to it and then realise it's gone. I'm getting old or something.
